greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n + (reversal of base-2 digits of n) (written in base 10).
comment: If n has an even number of digits in base-2 then a(n) is a multiple of 3.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{id = IntegerDigits[n, 2]}, FromDigits[id + Reverse@id, 2]]; Array[f, 69, 0] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 07 2010 *)
program: a055944 n = n + a030101 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 14 2011
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 18 2000
